newsitem.title: DUBAI: Saudi SAFCO profit rises in first nine months.
newsitem.headline: Saudi SAFCO profit rises in first nine months.

text.p: Saudi Arabian Fertiliser Company (SAFCO) had a 504.41 million riyal net profit in the first nine months of 1996, compared with 412.44 million riyals during the same period last year, a newspaper said on Monday.
A company official told the London-based Asharq al-Awsat newspaper that higher international petrochemicals prices were behind the 22 percent rise in profit.
SAFCO, 41 percent of whose shares are owned by Saudi's industrial giant Saudi Basic Industries Corp (SABIC), produces ammonia, urea, sulphuric acid and melamine.
